alert.note: Alert for Bradford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 11:14PM EST until February 19 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt, with localized ice jams possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Bradford. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate rain and significant snow melt. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Towanda, Canton, Troy, Wyalusing, Wysox, Ulster, North Towanda, Springfield, New Albany, Overton, Sylvania, Burlington, Franklindale, Monroeton, Le Roy, Wetona, East Smithfield, South Branch, Grover and Sugar Run. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
